title: SB 1.17.35 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 15-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः
नमाओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शून्यवादी पास्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभू नित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवास अधी गवरभक्त वृन्दा

Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam Deviim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from three verses, verses 35, 36 and 37 of the 17th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Sūta Uvāca
Parīkṣitāivam ādiṣṭaha
Sakalir jātavē patuhu
Tam udyatāsim āhedam
Dandapāṇim ivaudhyatam
The meaning of this verse is
Śrī Sūta Goswāmī said
Now this is a verse spoken by Sūta Goswāmī
who is describing these events leading to Parīkṣit Mahārāja meeting Śukadeva Goswāmī.
Remember the Bhagavatam began
with a conversation between
Sūta Goswāmī and the sages of the Sūta Goswāmī.
The words Sūnai Mishār 달라
so Sūta Goswāmī is narrating the events leading to
The original Bhagavatam is spoken by
Shukadeva Goswāmī to
Parīkṣit Mahārāja
The same Bhagavatam
is going to be recited by Sūta Goswāmī
to the sage Sūnai Mishārana
but before reciting the events,
the Bhagavatam is mentioned that
first and foremost,
The sages have requested him kindly tell us something about who is Parikshit Maharaj, who is Shukadev Goswami, how did they meet each other.
So all the chapters practically in the first canto are descriptions of Parikshit Maharaj, Shukadev Goswami and the meeting, how the meeting happened, the events leading to that.

So Shukadev Goswami is telling, the personality of Kali thus being ordered by Maharaj Parikshit began to tremble in fear, seeing the king before him like Yamaraj ready to kill him, Kali spoke to the king as follows.
So Kali Purusha, as I mentioned in the previous session, he was afraid of Parikshit because Parikshit was ready to kill him.

For his nefarious act of unnecessarily harming the cow and the bull, so he surrendered and his life was saved, but what did he do after surrendering, what did he say, because Parikshit said you cannot stay, even though I have spared your life, you cannot stay in my kingdom, where religious principles are strictly followed according to scriptures.
